intro: Grevillea heteroneura, commonly known as the narrow-leafed grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and vibrant, red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. It produces nectar-rich flowers that attract birds and insects, contributing to its ecological importance. Grevillea heteroneura is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
